intro: Schizotechium turkestanicum, commonly known as the Turkestan milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Schizotechium turkestanicum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils.
